Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Distal \Dis"tal\, a. [From {Distant}.] (Physiol.) (a) Remote from the point of attachment or origin; as, the distal end of a bone or muscle; -- opposed to {proximal}. (b) Pertaining to that which is distal; as, the distal tuberosities of a bone. [1913 Webster]
distal adj 1: situated farthest from point of attachment or origin, as of a limb or bone [ant: {proximal}] 2: directed away from the midline or mesial plane of the body [ant: {mesial}]
